questions.text: During prolonged fasting or starvation, ketone bodies such as β-hydroxybutyrate serve as an important alternative energy source for many tissues. Which of the following organs cannot utilize β-hydroxybutyrate for energy?

A 2-year-old child becomes lethargic and hypoglycemic after an overnight fast. No ketone bodies are detected in the urine. There is increased dicarboxylic acid. Which of the following substrates metabolism is defective causing hypoglycemia with no ketone bodies in this child when fasting?

A 24-year-old medical student eats a carbohydrate-rich meal after a long day of fasting. Within an hour, insulin secretion increases, leading to enhanced glycogenesis in the liver. Which of the following activated intermediates directly donates glucose residues during this reaction, and which enzyme is primarily responsible?

choices.text: Activation of amino acids by aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase
Correct positioning of the initiator tRNA at the start codon
Translocation of the ribosome along the mRNA

questions.text: A 36-year-old man presents with severe pharyngitis, low-grade fever, and cervical lymphadenopathy. A grayish-white pseudomembrane is observed over the tonsils. A throat swab confirms Corynebacterium diphtheriae infection. The toxin specifically targets a factor that mediates GTP hydrolysis during which of the following steps of translation?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Translocation of the ribosome along the mRNA

questions.text: A 45-year-old woman is started on an experimental drug that inhibits an enzyme. A Lineweaver–Burk plot is performed to study the enzyme kinetics in the presence and absence of the drug. The plot demonstrates an increased slope and an increased y-intercept, but the x-intercept remains unchanged. Which of the following best describes the mechanism of enzyme inhibition of this drug?

choices.text: Patients may be treated with dietary supplements of vitamin B1
Patients may be treated with dietary supplements of vitamin C
There is deficient excretion of homocysteine
There is a defect in the ability to form cystathionine from homocysteine and serine

questions.text: An adolescent female develops hemiballismus after anesthesia for a routine operation. She is tall and lanky, and it is noted that she and her sister both had previous operations for dislocated lenses of the eyes. The symptoms are suspicious for the disease homocystinuria. Which of the following statements is descriptive of this disease?
questions.solution: Ans. D) There is a defect in the ability to form cystathionine from homocysteine and serine

questions.text: A 45-year-old woman is undergoing evaluation for a rapidly growing breast mass. To measure the rate of DNA synthesis, the pathologist incubates the cells with a radioactive nucleotide that is incorporated specifically during the S phase of the cell cycle. Which of the following labeled precursors would most accurately reflect DNA synthesis in this tumor?

A 10-year-old girl is brought to the emergency department with recurrent episodes of colicky abdominal pain, tingling and weakness of the limbs, and difficulty concentrating at school. Her mother reports she has a habit of chewing paint chips from old walls in their house. On examination, she has a pale conjunctiva and a bluish line on her gingiva. Laboratory findings show:

  • Microcytic hypochromic anemia
  • Elevated urinary δ-aminolevulinic acid (ALA)

Which of the following enzymes is most likely inhibited in this patient?

choices.text: Uncoupling of oxidative phosphorylation by allowing protons to flow freely across the inner mitochondrial membrane
Inhibition of the F₀ subunit of ATP synthase, preventing proton re-entry into the mitochondrial matrix
Direct inhibition of electron flow through complexes I and III
Activation of the proton channel of ATP synthase, increasing ATP production

questions.text: A 50-year-old man accidentally ingests a contaminated herbal preparation. He develops severe metabolic acidosis, hypotension, and dies within hours. Post-mortem analysis reveals that the contaminant contained oligomycin, a macrolide toxin derived from Streptomyces. Mitochondrial studies show markedly reduced ATP production despite normal oxygen levels. Which of the following best explains the biochemical mechanism underlying oligomycin toxicity?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Inhibition of the F₀ subunit of ATP synthase, preventing proton re-entry into the mitochondrial matrix

questions.text: A 24-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department after being found unconscious following an intense workout in a poorly ventilated gym. On arrival, she is tachypneic with a heart rate of 120 bpm. She has lactic acidosis secondary to tissue hypoxia. Under these anaerobic conditions, continued ATP production by glycolysis requires regeneration of NAD⁺ to sustain the reaction catalyzed by glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate dehydrogenase. This regeneration of NAD⁺ occurs through the activity of which of the following enzymes?

A 32-year-old man of Mediterranean ancestry presents to the emergency department with sudden onset of jaundice, fatigue, and dark urine after taking an antimalarial medication while traveling. He has no prior history of liver disease. Laboratory results show a hemoglobin level of 8.5 g/dL (normal 13–17 g/dL), elevated indirect bilirubin, increased reticulocyte count, and the presence of “bite cells” on peripheral smear. Enzyme assay confirms glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase (G6PD) deficiency. This enzyme deficiency directly impairs the production of which of the following molecules, and secondarily compromises which pathway that depends on it?
questions.solution: Ans. D) NADPH; fatty acid synthesis

questions.text: Identify the correct regulatory molecules:
questions.solution: Ans. D) A = Insulin; B = Glucagon

questions.text: A male child presents with delayed development and scarring of the lips and hands. His parents have restrained him because he obsessively chews on his lips and fingers. Which of the following is likely to occur in this child?

A 34-year-old patient is diagnosed with a mitochondrial disorder caused by a point mutation in the mitochondrial genome. Genetic analysis reveals that the mutation affects a codon that normally does not exhibit degeneracy, resulting in failure to incorporate a specific amino acid into the growing polypeptide chain. Which of the following amino acids is most likely affected?
Which one of the following is elevated in plasma during the absorptive period (compared with the postabsorptive state)?

A 45-year-old female patient presents to the clinic with complaints of recurrent episodes of fatigue, dizziness, and syncope, especially during physical activity. On examination, her blood pressure is 100/70 mm Hg, and a systolic murmur is heard along the left sternal border. An echocardiogram reveals severe aortic stenosis. Right coronary artery origin part was affected. Where does the right coronary artery originate from?

choices.text: Emerges from the medial border of psoas major
The anterior branch of this nerve contributes to patellar plexus

questions.text: A 50-year-old female visited the neurologist with complaints of pain, tingling sensation and numbness over the upper thigh. The neurologist on examination, found that there was no motor weakness of the lower limb and noticed that the pain told by the patient was confined to the upper anterolateral aspect of the thigh. He told the patient that she had meralgia paresthetica. Which of the following statements is true about the nerve responsible for this condition?
questions.solution: Ans. D) The anterior branch of this nerve contributes to patellar plexus

questions.text: This 50-year-old woman presented after surgical resection of squamous cell carcinoma of the skull base followed by radiation therapy. Later she presented with the complaints of loss of transverse wrinkles over left forehead, inability to close her left eye, drooling of saliva, dry tongue. Which of the following syndrome is related to the nerve injured in this patient?

choices.text: Left Gluteus minimus and Gluteus medius
Right Gluteus minimus and Gluteus medius

questions.text: A patient was asked to stand on his left leg and his right hip falls down. Which among the following muscles will be affected in this case?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Left Gluteus minimus and Gluteus medius

questions.text: A 55-year-old woman presents with sudden onset of drooping of her right upper eyelid and double vision. On examination, her right eye is deviated downwards and laterally, and the pupil is dilated and non-reactive to light. MRI angiography reveals a berry aneurysm arising from the posterior communicating artery. Which of the following structures is most likely compressed?

choices.text: Right gastric and Right gastroepiploic artery
Right gastric and Left gastric artery
Right gastroepiploic artery and short gastric vessels
Right gastric and short gastric vessels

questions.text: Ligation of the common hepatic artery will impair blood supply in?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Right gastric and Right gastroepiploic artery

choices.text: Abnormal collection of serous fluid in a part of tunica albugenia
Dartos muscle is supplied by femoral branch of genitofemoral nerve
Testis and spermatic cord cannot be palpated separately
Dartos muscle is supplied by genital branch of genitofemoral nerve

questions.text: A 14-year-old boy was brought to the surgery OPD because of swelling over right scrotum. On examination, transillumination revealed fluid accumulation within the scrotum. This boy was diagnosed with hydrocele and was posted for surgery the next day. Which of the following statements is true about hydrocele?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Dartos muscle is supplied by genital branch of genitofemoral nerve

questions.text: Pleural tapping, also known as thoracentesis, is a procedure performed to remove excess fluid from the pleural space in the chest. It is often indicated in cases of pleural effusion to relieve dyspnea or to diagnose the underlying cause of the effusion. The procedure involves the insertion of a needle or catheter into the pleural space, usually under ultrasound guidance, to ensure safety and precision. Post-procedure, the patient is monitored for potential complications such as pneumothorax. Which of the following is not pierced during pleural tapping?

In the anatomical arrangement of intermuscular spaces such as the cubital fossa, femoral triangle, anatomical snuff box, etc., what primarily forms the roof of these spaces?

  1. Skin 
  2. Superficial fascia 
  3. Subcutaneous fat, cutaneous nerves and vessels
  4. Deep fascia

choices.text: The flexing of the arm with respect to the forearm around the elbow.
The swinging of the foot to the medial and lateral directions.
The downward & upward rotation of hand when elbow is semi flexed.
The rotation at the shoulder that causes the arm to describe a cone shape.

questions.text: Which of the following describes the movements known as pronation and supination?
questions.solution: Ans. C) The downward & upward rotation of hand when elbow is semi flexed.

questions.text: Match the correct pair:
A 21 year old patient Suyash came to OPD with history of fall on hand. Now he is having pain at hand region. X-ray of patient is given. Which of the following joint has been shown in his X-ray?

A 32-year-old woman presents to the emergency department after falling onto her outstretched hand. She complains of severe pain in her elbow. Physical examination reveals swelling and tenderness over the distal humerus. An X-ray confirms a supracondylar fracture. Upon further examination, the patient is unable to flex her thumb. Which nerve is most likely involved in this patient's presentation?

A 65-year-old patient with a history of hypertension and diabetes is admitted to the hospital with complaints of weakness in the hand and difficulty holding objects. The patient's medical history includes a recent cerebrovascular accident (CVA). A "card test" is performed as part of the neurological examination. Which of the following muscle groups is primarily assessed with this test to check for motor function in the hand?

choices.text: The first part of axillary artery lies above A
Its upper border is accompanied by superior thoracic artery
Its contraction causes upward rotation of glenoid cavity of scapula

questions.text: All of the following statements are true about the structure labelled A in the given image except?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Its contraction causes upward rotation of glenoid cavity of scapula

questions.text:
A 27-year-old woman with PCOS is started on Letrozole for ovulation induction. Regarding Letrozole, which statements are correct? 

1. It increases FSH by inhibiting aromatase
2. It causes anti-estrogenic effects on endometrium
3. It increases intraovarian androgen levels
4. It directly increases LH surge

choices.text: 4 g IV + 10 g IM followed by 5 g IM q4h
4 g IV + 5 g IM followed by 5 g IM q6h
6 g IV + 10 g IM followed by 5 g IM q6h
4 g IV only, repeated after 4 hours

questions.text: A 32-year-old G2P1 at 34 weeks presents with BP 170/110 mmHg, epigastric pain, and platelet count 80,000/mm³. AST 280 IU/L. Urine protein +++. She develops seizures in the ward. Which of the following regimens for magnesium sulfate is correct?
questions.solution: Ans. A) 4 g IV + 10 g IM followed by 5 g IM q4h

questions.text:
Which of the following is done in cord prolapse with a live fetus? 

  1. Reposition presenting part manually
  2. Trendelenburg or knee-chest position
  3. Replacing the umbilical cord inside the uterus 
  4. Immediate cesarean section

choices.text: Placenta previa is a major risk factor
MRI is better than ultrasound for depth assessment
Managed best by manual removal and curettage
Cesarean hysterectomy is standard in accreta

questions.text: In placenta accreta spectrum, which of the following statements is incorrect?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Managed best by manual removal and curettage

questions.text:
Arrange the following phases of the menstrual cycle according to hormonal events:

  1. LH surge
  2. Ovulation
  3. Progesterone peak
  4. FSH rise

A 16-year-old girl with primary amenorrhea presents to the OPD. On evaluation, she has normal breast development and pubic and axillary hair. On ultrasound the uterus is not seen but ovaries appear normal. Her karyotype is 46, XX. Which of the following hormones are expected?
1. Normal FSH
2. Low estrogen
3. Normal AMH
4. Elevated LH

Arrange steps in Pap smear collection:

  1. Insert speculum
  2. Visualize cervix
  3. Rotate Ayre’s spatula 360°
  4. Smear on slide
  5. Fix immediately

choices.text: Hysteroscopic myomectomy after correction of anemia

questions.text: A 38-year-old P1L1  presents with 8-month history of heavy, prolonged menses and increasing lower abdominal pain. On examination, the uterus is enlarged to 8-week size, firm, regular, and mobile. Ultrasound shows a 3 cm submucosal distorting the cavity. Her hemoglobin is 8.5 g/dL. She wishes to preserve fertility. Which is the most appropriate next step?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Hysteroscopic myomectomy after correction of anemia

questions.text: A 30-year-old presents with 3 consecutive first-trimester losses. Work-up reveals Lupus anticoagulant positive twice 12 weeks apart; TSH, prolactin normal; karyotypes normal. Which are recommended in next pregnancy?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Aspirin and Prophylactic LMWH

choices.text: Continue antihypertensive and steroids, reassess in 48 h

questions.text: A 34-year-old G2P1 at 31 weeks with chronic hypertension on labetalol develops headache, visual blurring, and right-upper-quadrant pain. BP = 170/112 mmHg, platelets = 80 k/mm³, AST = 290 IU/L, bilirubin = 1.6 mg/dL. Fetal Doppler shows Absent end diastolic flow. What is the optimal plan?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Immediate delivery after maternal stabilization

choices.text: Wait till labor and LSCS if bleeding
Vaginal delivery if repeat ultrasound after 2 weeks is normal

questions.text: A 30-year-old G2P1 at 34 weeks has recurrent vaginal bleeding. She is otherwise comfortable. The fetal heart rate is 144 bpm. Her PR is 80/min and BP is 110.70 mmHg. On evaluation her Hb = 8.2 g/dL. An ultrasound done is as shown.  Best timing and mode of delivery?

choices.text: Continuous electronic fetal monitoring in first stage
A companion of choice during labour & birth
Routine fundal pressure in second stage

questions.text: A 25-year-old primigravida enters spontaneous labour at 39 weeks, no complications. According to the WHO intrapartum care guideline (2018), which of the following is recommended for all women during labour?
questions.solution: Ans. B) A companion of choice during labour & birth

questions.text: You are attending a skills lab training on assisted breech delivery. The baby has been delivered till as shown. What is the next maneuver that is done?

choices.text: At the level of the uterine artery ligation
Near the infundibulopelvic ligament during adnexectomy
At the bladder base during anterior vaginal wall dissection
At the level of round ligament transection

questions.text: All of the following are common sites of ureteric injury during hysterectomy except:
questions.solution: Ans. D) At the level of round ligament transection

questions.text: A patient is undergoing laparoscopic evaluation in view of infertility. She has been having irregular cycles and has been unsuccessfully trying to conceive since 1 year. On laparoscopic Chromotubation, the fallopian tubes are patent. The ovaries appear big and bulky. What is the diagnosis?
A 65-year-old woman with complaints of mass per vaginum, as shown in the below image was posted for operative repair. Which of the following procedures is recommended for her?

A 27-year-old P2L2 teacher comes for contraceptive counselling. She has been using condoms but now wants something more long acting. She has regular periods lasting for 6 days and she uses the menstrual cup for the same but sometimes has to use additional pads also. She has been recently diagnosed with varicose veins in her legs but has no personal history of thrombo-embolism. She does not smoke or drink alcohol. Her vital signs are normal.  Pelvic examination is normal. Which of the following is the most appropriate contraceptive choice?

A 35 year old G4 presents to the OPD with a missed period of 2 months. A pregnancy test at home is positive. She complains of nausea. An ultrasound is ordered which shows the following. Which is most likely?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Single intra uterine fetus

questions.text: Which is true regarding Swyer syndrome?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Pregnancy possible with donor oocyte

questions.text: What is this graph a part of?

A term baby, born via elective C-section, develops respiratory distress 1 hour after birth. RR is 72/min, SpO₂ is 90% on room air, no significant retractions, and CXR shows prominent vascular markings with fluid in fissures. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Transient Tachypnea of Newborn

choices.text: Central apnea due to immature respiratory center

questions.text: A 32-week preterm develops recurrent apnea episodes, mainly during sleep. Sepsis and metabolic workup are negative. Most likely cause?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Central apnea due to immature respiratory center

choices.text: Start oral feeds and recheck sugar in 1 hour
Observe and repeat sugar after 3 hours

questions.text: A 2-hour-old, 2.1 kg baby presents with jitteriness, poor feeding, and irritability. Blood sugar: 35 mg/dL. What is the next best step?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Give IV bolus 10% dextrose

questions.text: A 1-day-old neonate develops tachypnea and poor feeding. Mother had PROM for 20 hours. Most likely organism?
A preterm neonate develops respiratory distress on day 3 of life. Exam: bounding pulses, wide pulse pressure, systolic murmur at left upper sternal border. Most likely diagnosis?
A neonate develops seizures at 36 hours of life. Labs: calcium 6.2 mg/dL, PTH low. No thymic shadow on CXR. Most likely underlying abnormality is:
A newborn has difficulty breathing and feeding. Examination shows micrognathia, glossoptosis, and U-shaped cleft palate. Most appropriate immediate management:
questions.solution: Ans. B) Prone positioning and airway support

questions.text: A floppy male neonate presents with poor feeding and weak cry since birth. Parents report decreased movements in utero. Genital exam shows small testes. Most likely genetic mechanism:
A full-term neonate has not passed meconium for 48 hours. Abdomen is distended, and rectal examination produces an explosive discharge of gas and stool. Most likely diagnosis?
A term baby born to a couple with a history of cystic fibrosis develops abdominal distension and failure to pass meconium. Contrast enema shows a microcolon. Most likely diagnosis:
A 30-week preterm infant develops abdominal distension, bloody stools, and apnea on day 7 of life. X-ray shows pneumatosis intestinalis. Next best step in management:
questions.solution: Ans. B) NPO, NG decompression, IV antibiotics

choices.text: Observe and repeat X-ray after 6 hours

questions.text: A 3-year-old boy develops sudden onset cough, wheeze, and unilateral decreased air entry after eating peanuts. X-ray shows hyperinflation of the right lung with mediastinal shift to the left on expiration. What is the best next step?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Immediate bronchoscopy and removal

questions.text: A 9-month-old baby can sit without support, transfer objects from hand to hand, respond to name, but cannot stand with support yet. Which of the following best describes this child’s development?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Normal development for age

questions.text: A 7-year-old girl presents with fever, cough, RR 44/min, mild chest indrawing but no cyanosis, feeding well. Auscultation: crepitations. According to WHO classification, severity is:

A 12-year-old boy presents with height below the 3rd percentile. He is otherwise healthy with normal physical exam. His bone age is 10 years. His father also had late puberty and was a “late bloomer.” Most likely diagnosis:
